alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 10:35AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...The Mosquito Fork at the Taylor Highway. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 AM AKDT Wednesday, a river gauge and trained weather spotters reported an ice jam remains in place on the Mosquito Fork at the Taylor Highway. Impounding water due to the ice jam is causing rapid river rises upstream. The ice jam is showing some weakening with holes in the ice opening up near the bridge. - Ice on the Mosquito Fork remains up to the level of the bottom of the bridge. Water is reported flooding over bank along the Mosquito Fork. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Mosquito Fork, stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
